description: brick tower with a roof shaped like a crown being dislodged due to flames in the upper right corner; circular objects on the top and sides of the structure appear to be falling to the ground along with two figures that appear toward the bottom of the card; Roman numeral XVI printed on top border and LA MAISON DIEU printed on bottom; from a deck of 78 hand-colored triumph playing cards
provenance:
'Lady Charlotte Elizabeth Schrieber, 1812-1895, London [1]. Carl A. Weyerhaeuser, Minneapolis (by 1937); given to MIA, 1996.

1. Note with deck states: "Swiss Tarot. / Complete 78 Cards / from Schreiber Collection"
title: The House of God
